title: ServiceNow to Showcase “Everything as a Service” in Six Cities Globally
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/5/2015 @ 11:00 PM   ServiceNow 
SANTA CLARA, Calif. -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- ServiceNow® (NYSE:NOW), the enterprise cloud company, today kicks off the NowForum series of events, its annual enterprise transformation roadshow. In its third year, the series is dedicated to showcasing how organizations can run “everything as a service,” and will take place in Paris (Oct. 6), Frankfurt (Oct. 13), London (Oct. 15), Washington, D.C. (Nov. 3), Singapore (Nov.4) and Sydney (Nov. 11). In addition, on Oct. 14 the company will welcome approximately 300 application developers and architects to ServiceNow Developer Day, a 1-day developer conference in London. 
A recent survey revealed that eight in 10 companies still use manual tools such as email and spreadsheets to drive routine work, and employees spend nearly two days a week on non-strategic administrative activities. By defining, structuring and automating work through service management, ServiceNow can help customers can streamline time-consuming manual tasks and give organizations needed visibility into their enterprise services. 
“The activities that make up our day-to-day work life can be enabled by a common service model and delivered as a service in the cloud,” said Dave Wright, chief strategy officer, ServiceNow. “Service management isn’t just for IT – it is a discipline for how to better manage services across the organization. That is why this year’s NowForum roadshow is all about demonstrating how our most innovative customers are delivering everything as a service .” 
With more than 50 percent of sessions delivered by customers, the NowForum series is the top regional event for those who want to learn about service management from their peers. The event will feature customer-led presentations on topics such as IT, HR, and SIAM in addition to executive keynotes focused on managing, enabling and operating everything as a service. 
The Oct. 14 Developer Day is a dedicated educational and networking event for application development and delivery professionals. With a focus on helping developers use the ServiceNow cloud application platform, developer tools and program, as well as core platform technologies, this event enables organizations to develop and deliver enterprise-grade business applications rapidly and cost-effectively to the business. Fred Luddy, ServiceNow founder and chief product officer, will join Pat Casey, senior vice president of devops and general manager of ServiceNow’s platform business unit, to share with developers the company’s history, strategy and vision for the platform. The event will also feature a series of presentations and demonstrations by ServiceNow core platform experts on application models, integration, encryption, application marketplace, developer program, developer tools and more. 
The NowForum roadshow is expected to draw more than 3,000 CIOs and IT professionals from the world’s most innovative organizations. The Nov. 3 Federal NowForum in Washington, D.C., will draw professionals from all corners of the federal enterprise. Accenture is the premier sponsor for this event at all locations. In addition, 105 ServiceNow partners will be showcasing their offerings as part of the expo at each event. 
For more information or to register to attend the roadshow nearest you, please visit https://community.servicenow.com/community/nowforum/ . 
About ServiceNow 
ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before. Customers use our service model to define, structure and automate the flow of work, removing dependencies on email and spreadsheets to transform the delivery and management of services for the enterprise. ServiceNow enables service management for every department of the enterprise including IT, human resources, facilities, field service and more. We deliver a ‘light-out, light-speed’ experience through our enterprise cloud – built to manage everything as a service. To find out how, visit www.servicenow.com .
